**Practice Question – Basic Angle Facts**

> **Scenario:**  
> In the diagram below, two straight lines intersect at point \(P\), forming four angles: \(\angle 1\), \(\angle 2\), \(\angle 3\), and \(\angle 4\).  
> \[
> \begin{array}{c}
> \text{(imagine a “plus” sign)}\\
> \end{array}
> \]

> **Given:**  
> - \(\angle 1 = 70^\circ\)  
> - \(\angle 2\) is the angle directly opposite (vertical to) \(\angle 1\).  

Answer the following, writing only the numeric value (in degrees) requested.

---

### Part A  
What is the measure of \(\angle 2\) (the vertical angle to \(\angle 1\))?  

**Your answer:** __________°  

---

### Part B  
The two angles that lie on a straight line together form a **straight angle**.  
If \(\angle 3\) and \(\angle 4\) are a pair of adjacent angles that lie on the same straight line, what is the sum of \(\angle 3\) and \(\angle 4\)?  

**Your answer:** __________°  

---

### Part C  
All four angles around point \(P\) add up to \(360^\circ\).  
Using your answers from Parts A and B, find the measure of \(\angle 3\) (assume \(\angle 3\) and \(\angle 4\) are equal).  

**Your answer:** __________°  

---

*Write each answer on a separate line (e.g., “70”, “180”, “55”).*
